You are given $n$ segments on a number line. The $i$-th segment is represented by $[l_i, r_i]$, where $l_i \le r_i$.  A point is considered "bad" if it is covered by more than $k$ segments.

Your task is to find the minimum number of segments you need to remove so that there are no "bad" points. Output this minimum number of segments and a list of the indices of the segments you removed. 


Constraints:

* $1 \le k \le n \le 2 \cdot 10^5$
* $1 \le l_i \le r_i \le 2 \cdot 10^5$

You are given a list of intervals on a number line. Each interval covers all the whole numbers within it.  Find the fewest intervals you can remove so that no number is covered by more than a given maximum number of intervals.
